source:
a pit crew member was hit by a car on sunday during the inaugural indycar grand prix of louisiana .
todd phillips , a front-outside tire changer for dayle coyne racing , was injuried when he was struck by the car of francesco dracone , who had come in on lap 25 for tires and fuel .
dracone spun while exiting his put box , clipping phillips ' leg .
tire changer todd phillips , a front-outside tire changer for dayle coyne racing , was injuried when he was struck by the car of francesco dracone , who had come in on lap 25 for tires and fuel
phillips was taken to the infield care center for treatment where he has received stitches for a cut on his leg and has been released .
many cars struggled with traction during the race after rain had fallen for hours leading up to the green flag .
dracone did not finish the race and wound up 23rd .
francesco dracone ( 19 ) , of italy , spins out on turn one during the indycar grand prix of louisiana auto race in avondale on sunday
summary: During the inaugural IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, a pit crew member named Todd Phillips was injured when he was hit by the car of Francesco Dracone. Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was struck by Dracone's car on lap 25 while refueling and changing tires. Dracone spun while exiting his pit box, clipping Phillips' leg. Phillips was taken to the infield care center for treatment and received stitches for a cut on his leg. He has since been released. The race was affected by rain, causing many cars to struggle with traction. Dracone did not finish the race and ended up in 23rd place. Francesco Dracone, a 19-year-old from Italy, spun out on turn one during the race.

summary:
During the inaugural IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, pit crew member Todd Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was injured when he was struck by the car of Francesco Dracone. Dracone, who came in on lap 25 for tires and fuel, spun while exiting his pit box, clipping Phillips' leg. Phillips received treatment at the infield care center, where he received stitches for a cut on his leg and was released. The race was challenging due to rain-induced traction issues, and Dracone finished 23rd.

Francesco Dracone, a 19-year-old Italian driver, spun out on turn one during the race.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

During the inaugural IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana on Sunday, a pit crew member named Todd Phillips was injured. Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dale Coyne Racing, was hit by Francesco Dracone's car as it spun while exiting the pit box on lap 25. Phillips received stitches for a leg injury at the infield care center and was released. The incident occurred amid challenging track conditions due to pre-race rainfall, which caused traction issues for many drivers. Dracone did not finish the race, placing 23rd.

Phillips received stitches for a cut on his leg and was released from the infield care center. The race conditions were challenging due to recent rain, affecting many cars' traction. Dracone did not finish the race, ending up in 23rd place.
